verses.verse: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ׀ <S%H5329><s%> lam-natz-Tze-acho the chief Musician עַֽל־ <S%H5921><s%> [T'al-upon הַגִּתִּ֬ית <S%H1665><s%> hag-git-Tit upon Gittith לְאָסָֽף׃ <S%H623><s%> le-'a-Saf. [A Psalm] of Asaph הַ֭רְנִינוּ <S%H7442><s%> Har-ni-nu Sing aloud לֵאלֹהִ֣ים <S%H430><s%> le-lo-Him unto God עוּזֵּ֑נוּ <S%H5797><s%> 'uz-Ze-nu; our strength הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ <S%H7321><s%> ha-Ri-'u, make a joyful noise לֵאלֹהֵ֥י <S%H430><s%> le-lo-Hei unto the God יַעֲקֹֽב׃ <S%H3290><s%> ya-'a-Ko. of Jacob

שְֽׂאוּ־ <S%H5375><s%> se-'u- Take זִ֭מְרָה <S%H2172><s%> Zim-rah a psalm וּתְנוּ־ <S%H5414><s%> u-te-nu- and bring תֹ֑ף <S%H8596><s%> Tof; hither the timbrel כִּנּ֖וֹר <S%H3658><s%> kin-Nor harp נָעִ֣ים <S%H5273><s%> na-'Im the pleasant עִם־ <S%H5973><s%> 'im- with נָֽבֶל׃ <S%H5035><s%> Na-vel. with the psaltery

תִּקְע֣וּ <S%H8628><s%> tik-'U Blow up בַחֹ֣דֶשׁ <S%H2320><s%> va-Cho-desh in the new moon שׁוֹפָ֑ר <S%H7782><s%> sho-Far; the trumpet בַּ֝כֵּ֗סֶה <S%H3677><s%> bak-Ke-seh, in the time appointed לְי֣וֹם <S%H3117><s%> le-Yom day חַגֵּֽנוּ׃ <S%H2282><s%> chag-Ge-nu. on our solemn feast

כִּ֤י <S%H3588><s%> ki is a חֹ֣ק <S%H2706><s%> chok For this [was] a statute לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל <S%H3478><s%> le-Yis-ra-'El for Israel ה֑וּא <S%H1931><s%> Hu; he מִ֝שְׁפָּ֗ט <S%H4941><s%> mish-Pat, [and] a law לֵאלֹהֵ֥י <S%H430><s%> le-lo-Hei of the God יַעֲקֹֽב׃ <S%H3290><s%> ya-'a-Ko. of Jacob

עֵ֤דוּת׀ <S%H5715><s%> 'E-dut [for] a testimony בִּֽיה֘וֹסֵ֤ף <S%H3084><s%> bi-Ho-Sef in Joseph שָׂמ֗וֹ <S%H7760><s%> sa-Mo, This he ordained בְּ֭צֵאתוֹ <S%H3318><s%> be-tze-to when he went out עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- throughout אֶ֣רֶץ <S%H776><s%> 'E-retz through the land מִצְרָ֑יִם <S%H4714><s%> mitz-Ra-yim; of Egypt שְׂפַ֖ת <S%H8193><s%> se-Fat a language לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- did not יָדַ֣עְתִּי <S%H3045><s%> ya-Da'-ti [that] I understood אֶשְׁמָֽע׃ <S%H8085><s%> 'esh-Ma'. [where] I heard

הֲסִיר֣וֹתִי <S%H5493><s%> ha-si-Ro-ti I removed מִסֵּ֣בֶל <S%H5447><s%> mis-Se-vel from the burden שִׁכְמ֑וֹ <S%H7926><s%> shich-Mo; his shoulder כַּ֝פָּ֗יו <S%H3709><s%> kap-Pav, his hands מִדּ֥וּד <S%H1731><s%> mid-Dud from the pots תַּעֲבֹֽרְנָה׃ <S%H5674><s%> ta-'a-Vo-re-nah. were delivered

בַּצָּרָ֥ה <S%H6869><s%> batz-tza-Rah in trouble קָרָ֗אתָ <S%H7121><s%> ka-Ra-ta, Thou calledst וָאֲחַ֫לְּצֶ֥ךָּ <S%H2502><s%> va-'a-Chal-le-Tze-ka and I delivered אֶ֭עֶנְךָ <S%H6030><s%> 'E-'en-cha thee I answered בְּסֵ֣תֶר <S%H5643><s%> be-Se-ter thee in the secret place רַ֑עַם <S%H7482><s%> Ra-'am; of thunder אֶבְחָֽנְךָ֨ <S%H974><s%> 'ev-cha-ne-Cha I proved עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- at מֵ֖י <S%H4325><s%> mei thee at the waters מְרִיבָ֣ה <S%H4809><s%> me-ri-Vah of Meribah סֶֽלָה׃ <S%H5542><s%> Se-lah. Selah

שְׁמַ֣ע <S%H8085><s%> she-Ma' Hear עַ֭מִּי <S%H5971><s%> 'Am-mi O my people וְאָעִ֣ידָה <S%H5749><s%> ve-'a-'I-dah and I will testify בָּ֑ךְ Bach; יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל <S%H3478><s%> Yis-ra-'El, unto thee O Israel אִם־ <S%H518><s%> 'im- if תִּֽשְׁמַֽע־ <S%H8085><s%> tish-ma'- if thou wilt hearken לִֽי׃ Li.

לֹֽא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- Let there be no יִהְיֶ֣ה <S%H1961><s%> yih-Yeh become בְ֭ךָ Ve-cha אֵ֣ל <S%H410><s%> 'el god זָ֑ר <S%H2114><s%> Zar; There shall no strange וְלֹ֥א <S%H3808><s%> ve-Lo Nor תִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה <S%H7812><s%> tish-ta-cha-Veh, be in thee neither shalt thou worship לְאֵ֣ל <S%H410><s%> le-'El god נֵכָֽר׃ <S%H5236><s%> ne-Char. any strange

אָנֹכִ֨י׀ <S%H595><s%> 'a-no-Chi I יְה֘וָ֤ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh I [am] the LORD אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ <S%H430><s%> 'e-lo-Hei-cha, thy God הַֽ֭מַּעַלְךָ <S%H5927><s%> Ham-ma-'al-cha which brought מֵאֶ֣רֶץ <S%H776><s%> me-'E-retz thee out of the land מִצְרָ֑יִם <S%H4714><s%> mitz-Ra-yim; of Egypt הַרְחֶב־ <S%H7337><s%> har-chev- wide פִּ֝֗יךָ <S%H6310><s%> Pi-cha, open thy mouth וַאֲמַלְאֵֽהוּ׃ <S%H4390><s%> va-'a-mal-'E-hu. and I will fill

וְלֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo- did not שָׁמַ֣ע <S%H8085><s%> sha-Ma' would not hearken עַמִּ֣י <S%H5971><s%> 'am-Mi But my people לְקוֹלִ֑י <S%H6963><s%> le-ko-Li; to my voice וְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל <S%H3478><s%> ve-Yis-ra-'El, and Israel לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- did not אָ֥בָה <S%H14><s%> 'A-vah would לִֽי׃ Li.

וָֽ֭אֲשַׁלְּחֵהוּ <S%H7971><s%> Va-'a-shal-le-che-hu So I gave them up בִּשְׁרִיר֣וּת <S%H8307><s%> bish-ri-Rut lust לִבָּ֑ם <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bam; unto their own hearts' יֵ֝לְכ֗וּ <S%H1980><s%> ye-le-Chu, to walk בְּֽמוֹעֲצוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ <S%H4156><s%> Be-mo-'a-tzo-tei-Hem. in their own counsels

ל֗וּ <S%H3863><s%> Lu, Oh עַ֭מִּי <S%H5971><s%> 'Am-mi that my people שֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ <S%H8085><s%> sho-Me-a' had hearkened לִ֑י Li; יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל <S%H3478><s%> Yis-ra-'El, unto me [and] Israel בִּדְרָכַ֥י <S%H1870><s%> bid-ra-Chai in my ways יְהַלֵּֽכוּ׃ <S%H1980><s%> ye-hal-Le-chu. had walked

כִּ֭מְעַט <S%H4592><s%> Kim-'at I should soon אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֣ם <S%H341><s%> 'oy-vei-Hem their enemies אַכְנִ֑יעַ <S%H3665><s%> 'ach-Ni-a'; have subdued וְעַ֥ל <S%H5921><s%> ve-'Al against צָ֝רֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H6862><s%> tza-rei-Hem, against their adversaries אָשִׁ֥יב <S%H7725><s%> 'a-Shiv and turned יָדִֽי׃ <S%H3027><s%> ya-Di. my hand

מְשַׂנְאֵ֣י <S%H8130><s%> me-san-'Ei The haters יְ֭הוָה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh of the LORD יְכַֽחֲשׁוּ־ <S%H3584><s%> ye-cha-cha-shu- should have submitted ל֑וֹ lo; וִיהִ֖י <S%H1961><s%> vi-Hi to Him עִתָּ֣ם <S%H6256><s%> 'it-Tam themselves unto him but their time לְעוֹלָֽם׃ <S%H5769><s%> le-'o-Lam. should have endured for ever

וַֽ֭יַּאֲכִילֵהוּ <S%H398><s%> Vai-ya-'a-chi-le-hu He should have fed מֵחֵ֣לֶב <S%H2459><s%> me-Che-lev them also with the finest חִטָּ֑ה <S%H2406><s%> chit-Tah; of the wheat וּ֝מִצּ֗וּר <S%H6697><s%> u-mitz-Tzur, out of the rock דְּבַ֣שׁ <S%H1706><s%> de-Vash and with honey אַשְׂבִּיעֶֽךָ׃ <S%H7646><s%> 'as-bi-'E-cha. should I have satisfied
